intro: Hedyotis nanlingensis, commonly known as the Nanling endemic geranium, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically features small, opposite leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
